item.title: New website launches today
item.description: Hello Everyone! The new Entwine website has just been launched. There won’t be many blog posts here at launch, but stay tuned!

item.title: Legacy website
item.description: Farewell old website! The old website is still accessible here at the time of posting but eventually will redirect to our new home, and those pages will be gone forever…

item.title: Entwine membership growth
item.description: From Baseball to Football! When we established Entwine a few years ago, the number of academics involved would be enough to form a baseball team.

item.title: Edge Computing
item.description: Edge systems Hardware at the network edge provides an intermediate location for processing to occur between the servers in the cloud and the end device, be it sensor or actuator.

item.title: LowLow: Low power, low latency IoT image processing
item.description: Bringing real-time image analysis to the Internet of Things (IoT) poses many challenges.

item.title: Machine Learning
item.description: ML techniques can be used not just to process the data sets generated by the Internet of Things, but also to manage the IoT, to detect intrusions and other anomalies, and to optimise many aspects of IoT design, such as hardware location, spectrum usage optimisation and the minimisation of power consumption.

item.title: Network Infrastructure
item.description: The Internet of Things places new demands on network infrastructure and requires new solutions that address such distinctive features of IoT as the vast number of nodes, the huge amounts of data collected from leaf nodes of typically low bit rate, the novel network management issues that arise, and the need to support novel paradigms such as edge computing and edge networking.

item.title: Xiaojun Wang
